content: Shopping mall in SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Junction 10" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2018)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Junction 10**, formerly **Ten Mile Junction**, is a [shopping centre](/wiki/Shopping_centre) in [Choa Chu Kang](/wiki/Choa_Chu_Kang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) located at the junction of [Choa Chu Kang Road](/wiki/Choa_Chu_Kang_Road) and Woodlands Road. ## Background The mall opened in 1998 as **Ten Mile Junction** (十里广场). It is owned by [Far East Organization](/wiki/Far_East_Organization). It was accessible via the then-operational [Ten Mile Junction LRT station](/wiki/Ten_Mile_Junction_LRT_station), on the [Bukit Panjang LRT line](/wiki/Bukit_Panjang_LRT_line), which has been permanently closed since 13 January 2019. The platform was located on level 3 of the complex, which also houses the [Ten Mile Junction Depot](/wiki/Ten_Mile_Junction_Depot) adjacent to the station. The shopping mall was closed on 10 December 2010 and reopened on 30 December 2011 as **Junction 10**. It is stylized as JUNCT10N, similar to [Junction 8](/wiki/Junction_8) in Bishan. After reopening, Junction 10 became a [mixed-use development](/wiki/Mixed-use_development), together with The Tennery, a [private housing estate](/wiki/Private_housing_estate) occupying levels 4 and above. They consists of 338 innovative [SOHO](/wiki/SoHo,_Manhattan)-style [loft](/wiki/Loft) apartments with a variety of [recreational facilities](/wiki/Recreational_activities) such as open-air [swimming pools](/wiki/Swimming_pool) and [tennis courts](/wiki/Tennis_court). It is currently anchored by Mindchamps Preschool, [Fitness First](/wiki/Fitness_First) (formerly [Celebrity Fitness](/wiki/Celebrity_Fitness)), and [Sheng Siong](/wiki/Sheng_Siong_Supermarket) (formerly occupied by [Giant Hypermarket](/wiki/Giant_Hypermarket)). In addition, the two-level mall is home to tuition centres, [lifestyle](/wiki/Lifestyle_brand) shops, [beauty & wellness](/wiki/Beauty_care) services and [family restaurants](/wiki/Family_restaurant), and features an integrated [car park](/wiki/Parking_structure). - Official website This article about a Singapore building or structure is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Junction 10
